channel.title: Mika McKinnon / @mikamckinnon
channel.description: Twitter feed for: @mikamckinnon. Generated by nitter.42l.fr

item.title:
R to @DrWendyRocks: Plate technics move at the same rate your fingernails grow.
That just seems SO FAST every time I clip my nails. Like. LA is that much further north, and Victoria is buckled that much higher up and that much more stress is piling on!
item.dc:creator: @mikamckinnon
item.description:
Plate technics move at the same rate your fingernails grow.

That just seems SO FAST every time I clip my nails. Like. LA is that much further north, and Victoria is buckled that much higher up and that much more stress is piling on!

item.title: R to @rawnaeris: Very slowly cooled lava (basalt, rhyolite) or cold magma (gabbro, granite) is Safe But Boring To Lick if your fluffball is really craving volcano time. Even so, still Do Not Eat as rock is harder than teeth and no one enjoys emergency dentistry.
item.dc:creator: @mikamckinnon
item.description: Very slowly cooled lava (basalt, rhyolite) or cold magma (gabbro, granite) is Safe But Boring To Lick if your fluffball is really craving volcano time. Even so, still Do Not Eat as rock is harder than teeth and no one enjoys emergency dentistry.

item.title: R to @word_soup: Sharp! Pumice is cold bubbly lava, which makes it a glass like obsidian. Donâ€™t want a lacerated doggo tongue

item.title: R to @FossilLocator: Pretty sure the Moon is on the Do Not Lick list due to how annoyed scientists would be at you for contaminating a limited-availability research rock
item.dc:creator: @mikamckinnon
item.description: Pretty sure the Moon is on the Do Not Lick list due to how annoyed scientists would be at you for contaminating a limited-availability research rock

item.title:
Hot Lava is on the Do Not Lick list due to scorching. Cold lava is on the Do Not Lick list due to sharpness (non-doggos may cautiously lick obsidian, but itâ€™s boring)
Sand is Safe To Lick & the grittiness can be diagnostic, but itâ€™s Do Not Eat as it causes impaction.
item.dc:creator: @mikamckinnon

item.title:
Dear geo kin, Anyone worked with or visited Rainbow (Vinicunca) Mountain in Peru? I have a few questions and am having a very hard time finding legit info that aren't just echoing assumptions without any apparent original source.
Happy to contact non-Twitter if you have reccs.
item.dc:creator: @mikamckinnon
item.description:
Dear geo kin,
Anyone worked with or visited Rainbow (Vinicunca) Mountain in Peru? I have a few questions and am having a very hard time finding legit info that aren't just echoing assumptions without any apparent original source.

Happy to contact non-Twitter if you have reccs.

item.title:
R to @mikamckinnon: Imagine yourself standing on that dark layer. Youâ€™d need to look up to see it continue.
In areas that have experienced compressive stress, you see folds and reverse faults.
item.dc:creator: @mikamckinnon
item.description:
Imagine yourself standing on that dark layer. Youâ€™d need to look up to see it continue.

In areas that have experienced compressive stress, you see folds and reverse faults.

nitter.42l.fr/mikamckinnon/status/1055672960063688705#m

item.title:
R to @mikamckinnon: This sort of fault offset tells you the rock was compressed!
If rock buckles (folds) or breaks (faults) depends on if the rock is more flexible or brittle and how much force is applied over what timescale.
item.dc:creator: @mikamckinnon
item.description:
This sort of fault offset tells you the rock was compressed!

If rock buckles (folds) or breaks (faults) depends on if the rock is more flexible or brittle and how much force is applied over what timescale.

nitter.42l.fr/sciencenotscary/status/1541496446050091008#m

item.title:
Fault, fault, fault, find another fault! So many faults in one lil rock. ðŸ’œ
Look at how the strata (stripey layers of sedimentary rocks) are offset. Do you think this rock was pulled (extension) or squeezed (compression)?
item.dc:creator: @mikamckinnon

item.title:
R to @mikamckinnon: *canâ€™t comprehend
Itâ€™s like truly imagining astronomical distances or geologic timescales. I can know the numbers and have glib analogies, but I canâ€™t truly wrap my head and heart around how much pain this will cause every life it touches.

item.title:
I can comprehend how much suffering was unleashed today.
Every time I think I even have a list of ways this harmful, another aspect forces its way to my awareness. Itâ€™s justâ€¦ so much suffering.
